p: Figure 12 : The remaining oil morphology for different wetting conditions. ( a) In sample 1 (weakly water-wet), the remaining oil was trapped at the center of the pores as disconnected ganglia with quasi-spherical shapes. Panels ( b) and ( c) show how in samples 2 and 3 (mixed-wet), the remaining oil was left in connected, thin sheet-like structures in small pores and crevices. The different colors represent disconnected oil ganglia. Please click here to view a larger version of this figure.
